subjectgroup.subject: Drivetrain Vibration and Noise
International Tandem Suspension Axle Seat And U-Bolt Plate Applications For Code 14GDA And 14GDC Rear Axles Used On All Models
International Tandem Suspension Axle Seat And U-Bolt Plate Applications For Code 14472, 14474, 14475 And 14476 Rear Axles
General Rear Axle Seat And U-Bolt Plate Availability

item.para: International tandem suspension axle seat and U-bolt plate applications for Code 14GDA and 14GDC rear axles used on all models ( Table 1).
International tandem suspension axle seat and U-bolt plate applications for code 14472, 14474, 14475 and 14476 rear axles ( Table 2).
General rear axle seat and U-bolt plate availability ( Table 3).

lev1.title: DRIVETRAIN VIBRATION AND NOISE
lev1.para: Transmission and rear axle assemblies are made of parts machined to close tolerances and tend to be consistent with respect to vibration characteristics. They usually do not cause vibration complaints.
Transmissions and rear axles are connected together by drive shafts that may vibrate which can be interpreted as a transmission or rear axle vibration problem.

Drive shaft vibration can be caused by U-joint angles or miscalculation of working angles on tandem inter-axle drive shafts. If the U-joint working angle at one end of the shaft is three (3) or more degrees greater than the U-joint working angle at the other end, vibration may be encountered.
When diagnosing drivetrain vibration, the U-joint working angle should be checked (and corrected as needed) before disassembling the transmission or rear axle(s).

Inter-axle drive shaft working angles are sensitive to the ride height adjustment on International air suspension. The ride height must be set at 12.5 ± 0.25 inch (317.5 ± 6.5mm) for proper cancellation of the inter-axle drive shaft.
Also, unbalanced tandem axle loading on a 4-spring suspension can affect inter-axle drive shaft working angles. Refer to CTS-4352 for tandem axle balancing.
Pinion angles are controlled by torque rod length on Hendrickson suspension. The same principles of drive shaft alignment apply.

Listed in Table 1 and Table 2 following are typical axle seats and pinion angles for the new International axle codes 14GDA, 14GDC, 14472, 14474, 14475 and 14476. Both the actual seat angle and the pinion angle are tabulated.
Drive shaft angles should be checked with the vehicle loaded. Refer to DRIVELINE TROUBLESHOOTING in CTS-4352 in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

lev1.title: INTERNATIONAL TANDEM SUSPENSION AXLE SEAT AND U-BOLT PLATE APPLICATION FOR CODE 14GDA AND 14GDC REAR AXLES (W/52 INCH SPACING)
lev1.para: The following application chart shows the vehicle application for the chosen nominal pinion angle when the seat and U-bolt combination listed are used.

table.title: INTERNATIONAL TANDEM SUSPENSION AXLE SEAT AND U-BOLT PLATE APPLICATION FOR CODE 14GDA AND 14GDC REAR AXLES (W/52 INCH SPACING)

entry.para: ALL MODELS, w/center bearing, 4 spring suspension. Forward rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 2° ± 1°.
ALL MODELS, w/no center bearing, 4 spring suspension. Forward rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 4° ± 1°.
ALL MODELS, w/center bearing air suspension. forward rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 2° ± 1°.
ALL MODELS, NO center bearing, w/air suspension. Forward rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 4° ± 1°.
ALL MODELS, NO center bearing, w/4 spring suspension. Rear rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 12° ± 1°.
ALL MODELS, w/center bearing, 4 spring suspension. Rear rear axle nominal pinion angle well be 14.4° ± 1°.
ALL MODELS, w/o center bearing, air suspension. Rear rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 12° ± 1°.
8300, w/center bearing, air suspension. Rear rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 14° ± 1°.
93, 96, 9700, w/center bearing, air suspension. Rear rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 14° ± 1°.

note.para: On vehicles with air suspension, the pinion angle will go to the lowest value if the ride height value goes below the specified setting.
All vehicles with air suspension (except 4300) have an 8/10-inch-thick spacer between the rear rear axle saddle or seat and spring to compensate for frame rake (lower front).
On vehicles with 4 spring suspension, the pinion angle may be affected by unbalanced tandem axle loading.

lev1.title: INTERNATIONAL TANDEM SUSPENSION AXLE SEAT AND U-BOLT PLATE APPLICATIONS FOR CODE 14472, 14474, 14475 AND 14476 REAR AXLES (W/52 INCH SPACING)
lev1.para: The following application chart shows the vehicle application for the chosen nominal pinion angle when the seat and U-bolt combination listed are used.

table.title: INTERNATIONAL TANDEM SUSPENSION AXLE SEAT AND U-BOLT PLATE APPLICATIONS FOR CODE 14472, 14474, 14475 AND 14476 REAR AXLES (W/52 INCH SPACING)

entry.para: ALL MODELS, w/center bearing, 4 spring suspension. Forward rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 2° ± 1°.
ALL MODELS, NO center bearing, 4 spring suspension. Forward rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 4° ± 1°.
ALL MODELS, w/center bearing air suspension. Forward rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 2° ± 1°.
ALL MODELS, NO center bearing, w/air suspension. Forward rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 4° ± 1°.
93/96/9700, NO center bearing, w/4 spring suspension. Rear rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 12° ± 1°.
8300, NO center bearing, 4 spring suspension. Rear rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 12° ± 1°.
93/96/9700, w/center bearing, air or 4 spring suspension. Rear rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 12° ± 1°.
8300, S-Series, w/center bearing, air suspension. Rear rear axle nominal pinion angle will be 14° ± 1°.

note.para: On vehicles with air suspension, the pinion angle will go to the lowest value if the ride height value goes below the specified setting.
All vehicles with air suspension (except 4300) have an 8/10-inch-thick spacer between the rear rear axle saddle or seat and spring to compensate for frame rake (lower front).
On vehicles with 4 spring suspension, the pinion angle may be affected by unbalanced tandem axle loading.
Vehicles built prior to June 1, 1988, may be different.
Do not mix seat angles from side to side.

lev1.title: GENERAL REAR AXLE SEAT AND U-BOLT PLATE AVAILABILITY
lev1.para: The following list of axle seats and U-bolt plates are available through regular service parts channels.

table.title: GENERAL REAR AXLE SEAT AND U-BOLT PLATE AVAILABILITY

entry.para: 16864761 is for right side Eaton and Rockwell (SQ100) forward rear axles.
1514722C2 is for right side Eaton and Rockwell (SQ100) forward rear axles.
Will not fit right side Eaton or Rockwell (SQ100) without modification.
Left and right for Eaton and Rockwell (SQ100) rear rear axles.
Left and right for Eaton and Rockwell (SQ100) rear rear axles.
Left and right for Eaton rear rear axles.
Left and right for Rockwell RT-40, Spicer - either side.
